issue.title: [CF 656] Need help with a couple icons
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
r626

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No errors

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

So I can't tell  you how much I love TMW. A couple icons I would like to improve in my set.

1. Bloop Tap: Icon works great (Shows when stacks>5 to be usable and when there is a rune to fill it with), but I'm not sure how to set it up so that it shows a global cooldown like a normal ability. The issue is that it is actually tracking "Blood Charge" so that it shows the stack count of that buff and GCD's seem to just be for usable actions.

And last, no clue on this one so any help would be appreciated. On my blood DK, a couple of mop dungeons have undead that I like to "Control Undead" on for the majority of the instance and drag around as my pet. Because things go nasty if they "go free" during a fight and go right for the healer etc. I have learned to dismiss and re-control them between fights. Control Undead is supposed to last 5 min so I would love an icon that will only show up when I have a pet and that will show a timer for how long I have had it or a countdown from 5 min when Control Undead is used etc. You get the idea.
On the same note, an icon that shows when I lose a pet so that I can set it to really warn me if this happens (icon shake etc). Its obviously not something I want on my screen often (like when a hunter does not have a pet, but rather the loss of a controlled pet) since I seldom control undead. Not sure if that one is possible.

ATM this is my control undead. Just checks for "undead" target and no current pet.

comments.body:
1) Setup a cooldown icon for Blood Tap, add an Icon Shown condition to it that checks your Blood Charge icon, and set the stack text on the Blood Tap icon to [Stacks(group=1, icon=1)], replacing the groupID and iconID in it match those of the Blood Charge icon.

2) The string you gave is the same as the first one. However, this should work:

^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SBuffOrDebuff^SHARMFUL ^SUnit^Spet ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SControl~`Undead ^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^Sr_anim^F7912206404164636 ^f-54^SType ^SAnimations^Sb_anim ^F7912206404164636^f-53 ^Sa_anim^F5764607394185216 ^f-54^SPeriod ^N0.2^Sg_anim ^N1^SAnimation ^SSCREENFLASH^SEvent ^SOnHide^t ^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowTimerText^B ^SEnabled^B ^SICDType^Sspellcast ^t^N60416^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

It will show the duration of your Control Undead, and will flash your screen whenever it fades.

Edited Oct 11, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

On blood tap, I have to appologize. The reason it was not working is it is off the global cooldown. Totally missed that one. =/ Sorry about that one.

I was able to play with the Control Undead monitoring button yesterday and it worked just like I wanted - thanks a lot.
